GapFillDragDrop.Title: Comparative adjectives
GapFillDragDrop.Instruction: Click and drag the correct answer into each gap. Each answer is a comparative form.
GapFillDragDrop.ContentGapFillDragDrop:
1. Mike's car cost €17,000 and Dave's car cost €13,000. Mike's car wasmore expensive than
Dave's car.
2. My cat weighs four kilos and my dog weighs seven kilos. The dog isheavier thanthe cat.
3. Dad is 38 and mum is 41. Dad is younger thanMum.
4. It's 31 degrees in Alicante and 33 degrees in Malaga. Malaga iswarmer thanAlicante.
5. Ferraris can go at over 200 kilometres an hour; Fiats can go at about 150kilometres an hour. Ferraris
arefaster thanFiats.
6. Nathan has $300,000 in the bank. Julian has $200,000. Nathan is richer thanJulian.
7. My house is 20 years old. Your house is 2 years old. Your house ismore modern than
mine.
8. You can wear a suit to business meetings but you can't wear shorts. A suit ismore formal than
shorts.
9. I can sit in my armchair for hours but I can sit on my sofa for only half an hour. My armchair
ismore comfortable thanmy sofa.
10. Millions of people watched the football on TV last night, but only thousands watched the film. The
football wasmore popular thanthe film.
